Description: Jar of buff marl pottery with flat base, convex sides and rolled lip rim; three pierced triangular lug handles applied on the shoulder.
Curator's comments: This is a rare example of this shape in marl pottery without red painted decoration.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (pl. xxix.236 (tomb register); pl. xxxv.D59c)
